title: Complexity of counting CSP with complex weights.
abstract: We give a complexity dichotomy theorem for the counting constraint satisfaction problem (#CSP in short) with algebraic complex weights. To this end, we give three conditions for its tractability. Let F be any finite set of complex-valued functions. We show that #CSP(F) is solvable in polynomial time if all three conditions are satisfied; and is #P-hard otherwise. Our dichotomy theorem generalizes a long series of important results on counting problems: (a) the problem of counting graph homomorphisms is the special case when F has a single symmetric binary function; (b) the problem of counting directed graph homomorphisms is the special case when F has a single but not-necessarily-symmetric binary function; and (c) the unweighted form of #CSP is when all functions in F take values in {0,1}.
